title.narrative: Contribute to respond to the most urgent food needs in high-needs and underserved areas in winter 2020-2021

description.narrative: The proposed project targets 7 camps in communities in Dana sub-districts in four communities, most of these camps were established after the last displacement waves between Jan and March 2020, 3 camps are registered in CCCM and the other 4 are not, so GAN will register them as soon as possible, The project target 1102 families with cash for food, the cash intervention is feasible in these camps as they all have access to different main markets in the targeted communities, four rounds of cash for food will be distributed in Jan, Feb Mar and Apr 2021, each round consists of 2 weeks for distribution and 2 weeks for validation and PDM, 50$ will be allocated for each family as recommended by cluster and CWG, GAN conducted a deep coordination with different partners working in the same area as detailed in the coordination section, although the data gained form the FSL cluster indicate to more than 90% respond in Dana but no partner plan to target the same vulnerable and underserved camps, the camps were targeted by GAN bread campaign in Aug and Sep 2020, according to the interviews and assessment, 99% said that the first priority is food, the proposed modality is a cash for food, as it is considered one of the most effective modality since the markets are available near camps, GAN will also train 15 committees in 6 out of 7 targeted camps and equip them with the needed tools for fire extinguishing, FAKs, and other flood tools, and the rest camp will be targeted by point organization as we coordinate with them. GAN developed a detailed awareness plan includes Key messages about COVID-19 for parents, children, coping with stress during COVID-19, dealing with children and adults, PESA, GBV, and PSS, the awareness will be conducted online through WhatsApp Monthly market assessment in terms of availability of the items, prices, and accessibility will be conducted to ensure the local markets are functioning and all beneficiaries have good and equal accessibility to the different goods. GAN will contract with a money transfer agent after assessing the markets and the vendors' capacities in the local markets. where the identified vendors will be responsible for delivering the cash amount to the beneficiaries in the different locations and the payment for the agent will be conducted after finalizing the distribution of each few days which reduces the security risk in delivering the cash in such a complex context.
